newsitem.title: GERMANY: Mercedes to hire 600 more workers in Bremen.
newsitem.headline: Mercedes to hire 600 more workers in Bremen.

text.p: Germany's Mercedes-Benz AG is to hire an additional 600 workers at its Bremen plant, after unexpectedly-high demand for its SLK Roadster model, the car-maker told a German news magazine on Sunday.

According to an advance copy of a report in Monday's edition of Focus, management board member Juergen Hubbert said Mercedes is planning a third shift at the plant to increase production from an originally-planned 35,000 units to 42,000.
Original sales projections for the Roadster, which the Daimler-Benz unit carried out in 1992/93, forecast demand for the car of up to 100,000 units.

"However, to our surprise the demand has been almost twice as high," Hubbert said, adding that technical capacity at the plant would not be expanded as the company did not know how long the boom would last.
"If the demand suddenly fell away, then we would have invested too much in machinery and equipment," Hubber said.
